name: LOT Polish Airlines "Poland's Independence" Boeing 787-9 Departing Warsaw Chopin Airport
description:
I'm back from yet another trip to Eastern Europe! You can expect a few new spotting videos from RZE as well as some new trip reports, the first of which I uploaded already. Stay tuned for more in the coming weeks!

Later this year, Poland will celebrate 100 years as a state after being partitioned in the late 1700s and effectively ceasing to exist on a map until 1918 when it became the Second Polish Republic after the end of the First World War. As such, flag carrier LOT Polish Airlines has painted two aircraft in this patriotic livery, this Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner, as well as a Boeing 737 MAX 8. Here we have the Dreamliner, SP-LSC, pushing back, taxiing, and departing Poland's largest city for a transatlantic flight to Chicago at the end of July. I personally think the livery looks fantastic! Enjoy this special catch.

Thanks for watching!

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: LOT Polish Airlines (LO/LOT)
Aircraft: Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner (B789)
Flight Number: LO3
Livery: "Proud of Poland's Independence/Dumni z Niepodległości Polski"
Engines: 2x RR Trent 1000
Registration: SP-LSC
Route: Warsaw-Chopin (WAW) - Chicago O'Hare (ORD)
Callsign: LOT 3
Runway used: 33
Date filmed: July 2018
Local time: 1700
